website_summaries.verdict: If you are looking for a chinois strainer with a solid build, effective mesh, and a decent price, you'd have a difficult time finding a better buy for your money.
pros: Has a sturdy stainless steel construction with fine mesh, so it's built to accomplish numerous straining tasks
Owners rave about how effective it is at removing very small particles from ingredients
Not too difficult to clean, plus it's dishwasher-safe
cons: A few expressed that the handle could be a bit longer, but most were happy with the quality

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Chinois
customer_reviews.text: Look there's a tiny gap between the metal on the top (the spacer) and where the net connects. Just pour boiling water on it and you won't have ANY mold issues. I don't know why some people who review chinois are like "MINE HAS A MOLD ISSUE! HEALTH HAZARD!" Just clean and sanitize the damn thing properly. What's so hard?
customer_reviews.author: TraviSS

customer_reviews.title: Real Chinois
customer_reviews.text: The only real chinois I found on Amazon. It is only 7" wide, but that is fine for just about anything most people need at home. It does a great job at filtering out everything but the tiniest of particulate. Buy one, your sauces will improve immediately!
customer_reviews.author: STLguy

customer_reviews.title: they are wonderful and take the place of miles of cheesecloth
customer_reviews.text: Had a chinois before, they are wonderful and take the place of miles of cheesecloth. Great for straining broth, separating pulp from fruit juice, and all sorts of other such tasks. Think delicious smooth sorbet!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Specialized cooking made easy
customer_reviews.text: I use this when I de-seed tomatoes for Homan marinara sauce and I love it! This had made it so much easier! Now, I don't scrape my knuckles while I de-seed and my nails aren't terribly thin from being in the citric acid. Hope this helps! Take care and stay safe everyone! 💞🌺
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Well made, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This piece of equipment has made broth making a pleasure. It Is sturdy and will strain even small herb particles from your stocks. I worked in a restaurant 30 years ago and used a chinois - made great soups and sauces but very hard to clean. This one is cleans up easily- highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Aesop

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a chinois I picked up at the Goodwill for $2.50. I was taking a chance as the chinois did not come with one. It's a little too pointed for my chinois. It is well-made and solid, so there is no fault with the product. It just doesn't exactly match what I have
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: A good chinois at a good price. Lacks protective wire frame but considering the price it is very good, given reasonable care.
customer_reviews.author: seblick

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality
customer_reviews.text: While making stock I first strain it through the China strainer with simple holes. This is used for the second straining to remove virtually all small particles. Very well made and dishwasher safe.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for preparing jams
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. It is large and sturdy enough to prep fresh strawberries and not allow the seeds through. Also good for other fruit for jam and has many other potential uses.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Y. Pocock

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Chinois pestle. Very sturdy and easy to clean, but not in the dishwasher! I dried it and put a layer of cooking oil to protect it. It is really a good investment if you use a chinois. It helped me a lot for my shrimp broth.
customer_reviews.author: VeroTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Great professional chinois!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a baker, and if you don't work in a professional bake shop sometimes it's difficult to find commercial-grade equipment. This fine-mesh strainer (chinois) is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kate H

customer_reviews.title: Good ole chinois
customer_reviews.text: It’s great. Gets the job done. It’s a little hard to clean as they usually are but I can always get the fine bits out.
customer_reviews.author: Carly Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Great pestle
customer_reviews.text: I got a chinois used without the pestle and this fits perfectly. Nice weight and great size. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.author: T. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Great size
customer_reviews.text: Good quality wood that sturdy enough to withstand heavy handed grinding nice size for hands to use
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good but small
customer_reviews.text: The pestle is pretty and well made - it is just a tad shorter than I had hoped. My fault for not measuring the depth of my ricer.... The other thing is it is a bIt "pointy" . But is still usable.
customer_reviews.author: Angela G

customer_reviews.title: incredibly useful
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I waited so long to get this...it's so useful! I've used it for pureeing and straining and so far it's held up well. The mesh is very fine, so it works well for washing small grains like quinoa, and it's tough/thick enough to withstand significant pressure when I'm forcing fruit and vegetable purees through.
customer_reviews.author: AJG

customer_reviews.title: Fine Craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: The sieve is ruggedly constructed of stainless steel. It will definitely last longer than I.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H

customer_reviews.title: A perfect pestle for your Chinois
customer_reviews.text: If your Chinois comes to a point, this pointed pestle does the trick and makes doing things like applesauce a snap. Good quality, natural wood.
customer_reviews.author: MadMax

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to make my applesauce. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Koon

customer_reviews.title: Bigger in person
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you pay attention, this is the size of my forearm when I bought it thinking it was going to be no bigger then my hand
customer_reviews.author: Jelly May

customer_reviews.title: good seive
customer_reviews.text: this is wonderful for getting out the fine fruit or tea when making Kombucha
customer_reviews.author: dinnye

customer_reviews.title: Time saver for big batch iced coffee
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with my purchase. I bought this for making iced coffee. I previously had to use almost 10 coffee filter to strain the grounds. Now I use this and maybe 2 filters to catch the fine grounds.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: My wife was happy when I gave her this so she wouldn't have ...
customer_reviews.text: My wife was happy when I gave her this so she wouldn't have to bother so much with cheesecloth when she makes homemade yogurt. This does a good job for what we got it for.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Good chinois.
customer_reviews.text: Half the price compared the expensive ones, however, it does the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Splinter

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool
customer_reviews.text: Very versatile! I use the ball end with my chinois to remove seeds from blackberries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good, solid product, looks about the same as I have used in professional kitchens. Time will tell how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great value for quality product
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived and looks exaclty like the more expensive ones ( real mesh instead of just holes punched in metal ).
customer_reviews.author: 9 yards

customer_reviews.title: Strong and well made pestle!
customer_reviews.text: I was given a good non-rusty Chinois with out the the pestle. I'm so happy with this one, it fits perfectly! I smashed the little dent right out of the Chinois with it!
customer_reviews.author: Honor

customer_reviews.title: worked great, well
customer_reviews.text: Used to filter wax comb bits from fresh harvested honey, worked great, well made
customer_reviews.author: [Temporary Place Holder]

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a little bit smaller than the one I am used to using, but it still works well.
customer_reviews.author: Brittnoose

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fine mesh
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a Chinois for years; this is one of the best blind purchases I have ever made. The mesh basket is fine enough to strain Kefir.
customer_reviews.author: Alpacamade

customer_reviews.title: Commercial duty.
customer_reviews.text: A very tight weave in stainless steel with a superior finish all the way around. The handle is robust.
customer_reviews.author: david himmelsbach

customer_reviews.title: This is not the size as described
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine strainer but it says it has a 7" diameter. In fact it is much larger - it is 8" which makes a big difference

customer_reviews.title: This is just what I needed. Somehow I lost ...
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed. Somehow I lost the wooden pestle that came with my juicer and it was worthless without it. Now I'm in business again. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: ARTHUR L. JOHNSON

customer_reviews.title: Has more than one use
customer_reviews.text: I use this for much more than Chinois, it is a good muddler, bean and avocado masher and garlic masher

customer_reviews.title: solid and sturdy drainer
customer_reviews.text: solid and sturdy drainer. wife loves it. will buy another.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Its fine just not the size that I needed for my strainer for canning tomato juice
customer_reviews.author: Jezzeriah Fulaytar

customer_reviews.title: Been looking for a new one for a while!
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made out of hardwood and will last longer than the one that was with set I previously had. This is the same as the one that my mom has and has had for 50 years so I am hopeful that this new one will last as long.

customer_reviews.title: Length is just right.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to complete my tools for making jam.

customer_reviews.title: Not the right fit for a chinois

customer_reviews.text: This product came in quickly and in great condition. Was exactly what I expected to receive. Am very happy.

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. So convenient to own. Great quality. Every home cook should own one of these.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Item was used for a conical strainer. Original part was lost. This one works just fine!

customer_reviews.title: very nice strainer
customer_reviews.text: works great and less expensive than going to Williams Sonoma for the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy puree and clean up
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier than getting out my entire food processor! It creates a very fine puree when used with the chinois. I don't know why I waited so long to get this!
customer_reviews.author: AJG

customer_reviews.title: now I just need the time to crush those mulberries ...
customer_reviews.text: now I just need the time to crush those mulberries that are eagerly awaiting in the freezer for me to make jam.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Huttner

customer_reviews.title: Chinoise
customer_reviews.text: It's a chinoise. It does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Feller

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: A rubber spatula works better although this is a nice piece.
customer_reviews.author: Sm1nts2escape

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: We make homemade red chili sauce from pods and this helps to push the pulp through a strainer. Makes the process much easier.
customer_reviews.author: N.L. Gale

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: This pestle was smaller than what I thought it would be, but otherwise it's fine
customer_reviews.author: Laurie R.

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace the pestle for an antique chinois whose handle didn't make it. Fits all the way into the very narrow tip, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa A. Althouse

customer_reviews.title: Not just for Chinois!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this pestle for baking, not for it's original purpose. It works great for me when I need to make deep impressions in cookies and cupcakes for adding jams and fillings. Each one looks uniform and this pestle does the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: Great quality works well. However you need to use the fat ball end in the chinois not the narrow end.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L. Grey

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This chinois is a fine enough mesh for straining prior to using cheesecloth. I worry about the relatively thin metal of the handle and the little spot welds for attachment to the equally thin basket top. As long as it is used gently it is an okay chinois.
customer_reviews.author: ddks

customer_reviews.title: The pestle was perfect and fit well
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a chinos cap about a year ago and didn't realize there was a pestle that went with it. The pestle was perfect and fit well, I wish I had one of these when I was using the cap -- it truly was a great help. I hope to keep using it in the future in good health.
customer_reviews.author: ItalianHomeChef

customer_reviews.title: Not for yogurt!
customer_reviews.text: I am sure this would be good for soups, but it is HORRIBLE for straining yogurt, which is what I needed it for! I will be returning this for something else!
customer_reviews.author: C. Wharton

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy build and meets my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for straining almond milk, broth, etc. Have used it about 20-30 times and shows no sign of wear or tear.
customer_reviews.author: Regina Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Splinter at the tip.
customer_reviews.text: There was a rather big splinter at the tip that went unnoticed until I've used/washed it once. The splinter chipped off when I used it the second time. Good thing the chinois was there to catch it. I only wish I had kept the packaging so I could return it instead of chucking it out.
customer_reviews.author: S Lim

customer_reviews.title: TO SMALL FOR WHAT I USE IT FOR, (do ...
customer_reviews.text: TO SMALL FOR WHAT I USE IT FOR,(do you carry a bigger size TO SMALL,I NEED A LARGER ONE
customer_reviews.author: GEORGE  T.  LOPEZ

customer_reviews.title: Very fine strong mesh!
customer_reviews.text: This is a true fine mesh Chinois cone strainer. I used it to strain a can of chicken dumpling soup and I was amazed at how the thick soup strained easily through the screen, while the solids remained. I didn't even have to push it through, I only had to swish it around with a spoon. If you need a very fine mesh this is your strainer. It costs more than the plain punched strainer or regular screen strainer for a reason!
customer_reviews.author: Matou

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Good Value Chinois
customer_reviews.text: When I get to use it I can say more. Mine came with the pointy end dented and bent in, so I bent it back out with the wooden Chinois thing I also ordered. Now it looks ok...but still shows where the bent part was. I think it is sturdy enough that I don't have to return it. Just a bit sad it came bent and dented. Appears to be fine for use.
customer_reviews.author: z1RoniTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: 43658 HICV Pestle for Chinois
customer_reviews.text: The strainer that goes with this pestle came exceedingly dented, but since I already had a large pot of tomatoes cooking I attempted to use it. This pestal I purchased that was supposed to be for this strainer DID NOT fit and I wound up with a mess trying to strain the tomatoes. This is a horrible pair to use for straining.
customer_reviews.author: jacquej

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Wood Pestle for Ergonomics' Size
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-shaped and well-sized pestle for use with my preferred Matfer cone Chinoise fine strainer. The Chinoise is cone-shaped and so the pestle also needs to by the same shape. I have owned 'heftier' pestles but that turned out not to be an issue with this product. Wood is inherently anti-microbial...but stains to the wood may deter all but the best-informed. Also, I liked an older profile (I am an older guy) but...hey, this works just as well if one can press a bit harder.
customer_reviews.author: James EllsworthTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the “toy” strainers
customer_reviews.text: I had this on my list for a long time. Finally pulled the plug and got it in time for Thanksgiving. It’s big and will out “strain” those little half moon things I have been using for years. Clear broth, smooth gravies, oh yes!!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I need to read more closely...
customer_reviews.text: Well it was my own fault, didn't read the listing clearly...it's a lot bigger than I thought it'd be!!! Gotta say that it's 100% true to size and very, very sturdy. I was just expecting a mini one (since that's what I'd searched for) but nope full size and quite frankly a little intimidating...to be honest it also looks like a...nevermind...
customer_reviews.author: Lovegrimm

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice sturdy chinois
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice sturdy chinois. I have used it for making coconut milk and it was far faster that using my much smaller strainer. I also used it to de-seed raspberry jam and it worked like a charm. No seeds made it through!
customer_reviews.author: mamadiz

customer_reviews.title: Helpful add-on to the Chinois
customer_reviews.text: It helps to strain food through the Chinois and fits down into pointed opening of it. I may just not have the knack of using it properly. I found the back of a wooden spoon was easier although it can't get down to the point. The item was exactly as advertised, so I can't fault it and it is a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Fisherperson

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful piece of kitchen equipment. Much easier to clean than I thought. It’s the best!
customer_reviews.author: rtmalone10

customer_reviews.title: it's a great kitchen tool and the quality on this version is ...
customer_reviews.text: High-Quality Chinois, much more affordable than home stores. Don't spend more than this, it's a great kitchen tool and the quality on this version is very good. I use it to strain ginger root for ginger simple syrup, used in cocktails.
customer_reviews.author: Dan B

customer_reviews.title: Just what you need for straining stocks
customer_reviews.text: The mesh filter is just what you need to avoid particulates in your finished stocks. Keep a muddler around for mashing and getting every drop you can.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: This worked great in preparing tomatoes for canning, it let the juice and pulp pass through but not the skin and seeds. I highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: tiny tiny tiny

customer_reviews.title: Wooden Pestle for Chinois
customer_reviews.text: I had picked up an older style stainless steel chinois at the Goodwill for $4.99 (what a bargain), this works just perfect. It's just a tad short, but then it discourages me from filling the chinois to full. Good solid wood, well shaped and nicely finished.

customer_reviews.title: It seems very sturdy. The pestle was purchased separately and fit nicely ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this strainer to use when making jelly. It seems very sturdy. The pestle was purchased separately and fit nicely within the strainer. Works very well.

customer_reviews.title: other uses
customer_reviews.text: I am a potter and I am always looking for tools I can use in my pottery. Some pottery tools can be very expensive so when I saw this in the cooking section I brought it for this purpose and it has worked out very well.

customer_reviews.title: Have an old collander with a broken pestle

customer_reviews.title: No, a chinois is not a fancy hair do. (It's a high end sieve.)
customer_reviews.text: My husband and son love to cook and were happy to try this out a few days after it arrived. They loved it. This is a high quality item; it arrived on time and was well packed.

customer_reviews.title: Great sieve
customer_reviews.text: Handle is long enough to balance across my sink or stock pot as I have used it. This is a great fit for me and my kitchen.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Pair it with a chinois and you have a great combination to crush anything for sauces and juice. You can use both end depending on what you use it for. It cleans easily and well.

customer_reviews.text: Perfect, I found what I was looking for and a great price.

customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for making broth "from scratch" and it should last a long time.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We use the Brands that Cook Stainless Steel Chinois at least three times per week. We are heavy into cooking and this tool is a must for making great sauces!
customer_reviews.author: aliswings

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice
customer_reviews.text: The pestle is a very good one, but smaller than the original pestle. However, it works, and that's all that was necessary. I'm not canning umpteen dozen jars of tomato juice like grandma did.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda J. Hunter

product_meta.title: HIC Harold Import Co. Chinois Fine-Mesh Sieve, 18/8 Stainless Steel, 7-Inch Diameter
product_meta.description: Style Name:Stainless Steel ChinoisHic’s chinois mesh sieve easily processes cooked ingredients into smoother sauces and soups with velvety textures and even consistencies for tastier results. No more lumps! Its 7" Diameter allows ample room to process Large amounts of ingredients quickly. Crafted from 18/8 Stainless Steel with fine-mesh (30 holes per square-inch), hic’s chinois allows liquids to pass through easily while retaining skins, seeds, and lumps. Easily create smoother soups and sauces. Use this fine mesh sieve to remove seeds, skins and other fibrous bulk From pastes and purees. A versatile kitchen tool to sieve, sift, and strain contents for silkier textures. Its sturdy handle and solid frame with helper hook steadies the chinois on the edge of pots and bowls for single handed use with less hand fatigue. Easy to use. Simply cook ingredients, pulse them in a blender, and pour blended contents into the chinois with a bowl placed at the base of the cone to collect the silky results. It’s the perfect addition to cooking tools and canning supplies for making creamier sauces, smoother soups, perfect purees and Pastes, flawless batters, jellies, Custards, curds, yogurts, and more. For best results, use with hic’s wooden chinois pestle (#43658) to help press pulp and thicker ingredients through the mesh. Measures 17. 5-Inches long (including handle) x 8-inches deep with a 7" Diameter. Made from 18/8 Stainless Steel frame and fine wire mesh, hic’s chinois is easy to use and dishwasher safe for easy cleanup.
feature_bullets: HIC’s Chinois Mesh Sieve for making smoother sauces and soups with velvety textures without any lumps for tastier results
Made from 18/8 stainless steel and fine mesh; solid frame with helper hook steadies chinois on pots or bowls for single handed use with less fatigue
Simply process cooked ingredients through a blender and pour into the chinois; collect processed contents with a bowl at the base of the cone shape
Liquids pass through easily while skins, seeds and lumps are retained; ideal for canning, sauces, Soup, purees, pastes, jelly, custard, curds and more
Processes ingredients quickly; use with HIC’s Chinois Pestle #43658 to press pulp and thicker foods through the mesh; dishwasher safe for easy cleanup

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars329 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
